Study: Comparison of Abbott ID Now and Abbott m2000 methods for the detection of SARS-CoV-2 from nasopharyngeal and nasal swabs from symptomatic patients.
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Overall agreement was 75% positive agreement and 99% negative agreement between IDNCOV and ACOV for all specimens tested.

Study: The Detection of SARS-CoV-2 using the Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2 and Roche cobas SARS-CoV-2 Assays
Detection Method: RT-PCR ( Roche cobas SARS-CoV-2 assay; Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2 assay)
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2 and Roche cobas SARS-CoV-2 assays show excellent agreement (>99%)

Study: Geospatial Hotspots Need Point-of-Care Strategies to Stop Highly Infectious Outbreaks: Ebola and Coronavirus.
Speed of assay: PCR: 2-6 Hrs; LAMP N/A; Serology N/A

Study: Rapid Detection of COVID-19 Causative Virus (SARS-CoV-2) in Human Nasopharyngeal Swab Specimens Using Field-Effect Transistor-Based Biosensor
Journal: American Chemical Society Public Health Emergency Collection
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The FET sensor responded to patient samples diluted as much as 1:1 × 105 (242 copies/mL)

Study: Diagnostic Testing for Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome-Related Coronavirus-2: A Narrative Review.
Detection Method: RT-PCR, Serology, Antigen Detection Tests, CT

Study: Evaluation of nine commercial SARS-CoV-2 immunoassays
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The results showed 100% specificity for the Wantai SARS-CoV-2 Total Antibody ELISA, 93% for the Euroimmun IgA ELISA, and 96% for the Euroimmun IgG ELISA with sensitivities of 90%, 90%, and 65%, respectively

Study: Point‐of‐care lung ultrasound in patients with COVID‐19 – a narrative review
Portable and accurate diagnostics for COVID-19: Combined use of the miniPCR thermocycler and a well-plate reader for SARS-Co2 virus detection
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The fluorescence readings were capable of clearly discriminating between positive and negative samples across the whole range of dilutions tested (from 2 × 105 to 625 copies)

Study: Detecting SARS-CoV-2 at point of care: Preliminary data comparing Loop-mediated isothermal amplification (LAMP) to PCR
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Using repeated RT-PCR as a 'gold standard', the sensitivity and specificity of the novel test were 80% and 73% respectively. Positive predictive value (PPV) was 73% and negative predictive value (NPV) was 83%.

Study: COVID-19 pneumonia: A review of typical CT findings and differential diagnosis
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): A large series based on 1014 patients reported a 97% sensitivity of chest CT for the diagnosis of COVID-19, while the mean time interval between initial negative and positive RT-PCR was approximately 5 days .

Study: The Laboratory Diagnosis of COVID-19 Infection: Current Issues and Challenges
Highly accurate and sensitive diagnostic detection of SARS-CoV-2 by digital PCR
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The overall sensitivity, specificity and diagnostic accuracy of RT-dPCR were 90%, 100% and 93 %, respectively

Study: Performance of VivaDiag COVID‐19 IgM/IgG Rapid Test is inadequate for diagnosis of COVID‐19 in acute patients referring to emergency room department
Detection Method: VivaDiag COVID-19 IgM / IgG Rapid Test lateral flow immunoassay (LFIA)
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): This study states that VivaDiag COVID‐19 IgM/IgG Rapid Test lateral flow immunoassay (LFIA) should not be used for diagnosis of COVID‐19 (n=110) since the test demonstrated poor sensitivty as measured by concomitant RT-PCR testing.

Study: Development of Reverse Transcription Loop-Mediated Isothermal Amplification Assays Q2 Q1 Targeting SARS-CoV-2
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): LoD of RT-LAMP assays suggested in this study, 100 copies per reaction, may not be enough for sensitive screening of suspicious patients. high specificity of RTLAMP assays suggested in this study would be a good feature for a confirmatory test

Study: Report from the American Society for Microbiology COVID-19 International Summit, 23 March 2020: Value of Diagnostic Testing for SARS–CoV-2/COVID-19
Speed of assay: N/A PCR; Serology develops 7-11 days postexposure to virus

Study: Diagnosing COVID-19: The Disease and Tools for Detection
Detection Method: Lateral Flow Antigen Detection; RT-LAMP; Microfluidic Devices;
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The lateral flow assay has demonstrated a clinical sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of 57%, 100%, and 69% for IgM and 81%, 100%, and 86% for IgG, respectively. A test that detects both IgM and IgG yields a clinical sensitivity of 82%. [Microfluidics] showed 100% and 87% clinical sensitivity and specificity for HIV

Study: All-in-One Dual CRISPR-Cas12a (AIOD-CRISPR) Assay: A Case for Rapid, Ultrasensitive and Visual Detection of Novel Coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 and HIV virus
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Both real-time and visual AIOD-CRISPR-based detections could detect down to 4.6 copies of SARS-CoV-2 N RNA targets in 40 min.

Study: Point-of-Care RNA-Based Diagnostic Device for COVID-19
Journal: Virus Diagnostic Methods and Techniques: Learning from the COVID-19 Global Outbreak
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Penn-RAMP process provided greater sensitivity than RT-PCR or LAMP alone. When using limited viral load, Penn-RAMP provided 100 times better sensitivity than a single LAMP test. **Was not tested on COVID samples. Used healthy mucosal samples spiked with HIV.

Study: Coronavirus disease 2019, whart we know : Review
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The positive rate of RT‐PCR for throat swab samples was reported to be about 60% in early stage of COVID‐19. CT in suspected patients was 97% based on positive RT‐PCR result and 75% based on negative RT‐PCR results

Study: In silico approach to accelerate the development of mass spectrometry-based proteomics methods for detection of viral proteins: Application to COVID-19 biorxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Theoretical trypsin digest of the 2019-nCoVpFASTA1 database produced tryptic peptides with average lengths of 8 to 18 amino acids. These results indicate that trypsin digestion is an appropriate choice for detection of these viral proteins

Study: Sensitive one-step isothermal detection of pathogen-derived RNAs medrxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): All four probe pairs were able to detect 1 aM of SARS267 CoV-2 RNA, thereby exhibiting higher fluorescence intensity compared to that of the related 268 viral RNA sequences

Study: Serological detection of 2019-nCoV respond to the epidemic: A useful complement to nucleic acid testing medrxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): IgM & IgG Sensitivity of 100%, Specificity of ~98%

Study: Molecular immune pathogenesis and diagnosis of COVID-19
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): RT-qPCR can only achieve a sensitivity of 50% to 79%, depending on the protocol used the sample type and number of clinical specimens collected. The sensitivity of SARS-CoV N-based IgG ELISA (94.7%) is significantly higher than that of SARS-CoV S-based IgG ELISA (58.9%), but the sensitivity of SARS-CoV-2 IgG/IgM remains to be studied.

Study: Clinical significance of IgM and IgG test for diagnosis of highly suspected COVID-19 infection medrxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The positive detection rate of combination of IgM and IgG for patients with COVID-19 negative and positive nucleic acid test was 72.73% and 87.50%.

Study: CRISPR-based surveillance for COVID-19 using genomically-comprehensive machine learning design biorxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Limit of detection of synthetic RNA target determined to be 10 copies/µl using both fluorescent and lateral flow detection. This assay performs well in comparison to the recently disclosed DETECTR assay (sensitivity: 70–300 cp/µl) and SHERLOCK assay (10–100 cp/µl) for SARS-CoV-2.

Study: Fecal specimen diagnosis 2019 novel coronavirus–infected pneumonia
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Five of the 14 confirmed patients (35.7%) had a positive stool sample COVID‐19 nucleic acid, and patients with positive stool samples were also positive for oropharyngeal swabs specimens at least the day before

Study: Imaging manifestations and diagnostic value of chest CT of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the Xiaogan area
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Rate of the CT examination in the diagnosis of SARS-CoV-2 infection was only 76.4%. Only three cases (2.6%) in this study showed no apparent abnormalities in the lungs at the initial CT examination, and the overall accuracy rate of CT examination in the present study was 97.3%

Study: Pixelated colorimetric nucleic acid assay
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Successful detection of HBV DNA was demonstrated in plasma, mimicking clinical samples, with a detection limit of 1 nM.

Study: Recent advances and perspectives of nucleic acid detection for coronavirus
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): High Sensitivity and Specificity of RT-PCR; RT-LAMP, Microarray and CRISPR are analagous

Study: Rapid Molecular Detection of SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Virus RNA Using Colorimetric LAMP medrxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Colorimetric LAMP assay showed 100% agreement with the RT-qPCR results across a range of Cq values,

Study: Development and clinical application of a rapid IgM‐IgG combined antibody test for SARS‐CoV‐2 infection diagnosis
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): the IgG‐IgM combined antibody test kit, has a sensitivity of 88.66% and specificity of 90.63%.

Study: Differential diagnosis of illness in patients under investigation for the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), Italy, February 2020 Euro Surveill
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Broad screening for respiratory pathogens revealed a high rate of influenza virus infections, accounting for 28.5% of all suspected cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

Study: A simple magnetic nanoparticles-based viral RNA extraction method for efficient detection of SARS-CoV-2 biorxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): pcMNPs have excellent viral RNA binding performances, which results in 10-copy sensitivity and the high linearity over 5 logs of gradient in SARSCoV-2 viral RNA detection using RT-PCR

Study: Development and Clinical Application of A Rapid IgM-IgG Combined Antibody Test for SARS-CoV-2 Infection Diagnosis
Detection Method: Lateral Flow Immunoassay for IgM and IgG against SARS-CoV-2
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): It requires minimal sample volume, i.e., 20 uL of finger-pricked blood or 10 uL of serum/plasma

Study: 2019 Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Paving the Road for Rapid Detection and Point-of-Care Diagnostics
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): RT-LAMP Sensitivity >95%; PCR Diagnostic sensitivity of 95%, Sensitivity of Serology 88.66%

Study: Diagnosis of the Coronavirus disease (COVID-19): rRT-PCR or CT?
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Sensitivity of CT examinations was 97.2% at presentation, whereas first round rRT-PCR sensitivity was 84.6%

Study: Potential Rapid Diagnostics, Vaccine and Therapeutics for 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV): A Systematic Review.
Detection Method: RT-PCR; RT-LAMP; RT-iiPCR; One Step rRT-PCR; ELISA
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, and negative predictive value of the test were ELISA: 98.2%, 98.7%, 98.7%, and 98.4%; RT-PCR: 52.2%, 78.7%, 74.5%, and 58.1%. Real-time RT-PCR was able to detect at level as low as 1.6 copies of MERS-CoV RNA while RT-LAMP was also able to detect viral RNA at levels as low as 0.7 copies, showing equivalence with the RT-PCR assay. Overall agreement between RT-iiPCR assays and reference RT-qPCR assays were 98.06% (95% CI, 94.43–100%) and 99.03% (95% CI, 95.88–100%) for ORF1a and upE assays, respectively.

Study: SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in urine, blood, anal swabs and oropharyngeal swabs specimens.
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): RT-PCR was used to detect SARS-CoV-2 RNA in urine and blood specimens, and anal and oropharyngeal swabs (n=9)

Study: Development and Evaluation of A CRISPR-based Diagnostic 2 For 2019-novel Coronavirus
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): PCR- and CRISPR-nCoV both had a specificity of 239 100% in our study.PCR-nCoV was able to detect the virus in 90.4% (47/52) of the positive 240 cases, with Ct’s ranging from 28.8 to 40.4 and a median Ct of 35.8. CRISPR showed a greater sensitivity [than PCR] by detecting all 52 244 nCoV-confirmed cases (100%), with FC values ranging from 5.0 to 66.3 and a median FC of 245 22.8 (Figure 4A).

Study: Laboratory diagnosis of emerging human coronavirus infections – the state of the art
Detection Method: Antigen EIA; Antigen IFA; Cell culture; Serology; NAAT (PCR), monoplex, pan-HCoV; NAAT (PCR), monoplex, specific-HCoV; NAAT (PCR), multiplex; NAAT (PCR), POCT
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Rapid, poor sensitivity, some are CLIA-waived; Good sensitivity and specificity, subjective interpretation; Gold standard, pure culture for further research and development, time consuming; Retrospective, cross-reaction; High sensitivity with universal coverage of all species of HCoV; High sensitivity and specificity for special species, potential quantification; High sensitivity and specificity, covering other pathogens, FilmArray RP EZ is CLIA-waived; Rapid and safe, good sensitivity and specificity, some are CLIA-waived

Study: Rapid colorimetric detection of COVID-19 coronavirus using a reverse transcriptional loop-mediated isothermal amplification (RT-LAMP) diagnostic platform: iLACO
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): iLACO is very sensitive, and as low as 10 copies of ORF1ab gene were detected successfully.

Study: Rapid Detection of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) by Reverse Transcription-Loop-Mediated Isothermal Amplification
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): RT-LAMP is specific and sensitive for COVID-19 (unspecified); RT-PCR has high sensitivity and specificity

Study: Comparison of throat swabs and sputum specimens for viral nucleic acid detection in 52 cases of novel coronavirus (SARS-Cov-2) infected pneumonia (COVID-19)
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The positive rates of 2019-nCoV from sputum specimens and throat swabs 12 were 76.9% and 44.2%, respectively. Sputum specimens showed a significantly 13 higher positive rate than throat swabs in detecting viral nucleic acid using qRT-PCR 14 assay (P=0.001).

Study: 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Taiwan: Reports of two cases from Wuhan, China Journal of Microbiology, Immunology and Infection
Journal: Journal of Microbiology, Immunology and Infection
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Unknown

Study: A  Single and Two-Stage, Closed-Tube, Molecular Test for the 2019  Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)at Home, Clinic, and Points of Entry
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): COVID-19 LAMP and COVID-19 PCR provided 100% sensitivity at 700 viral particles per reaction and 75% sensitivity at 70 viral copies per reaction (Table 2). In contrast, COVID-19 Closed-Tube Penn-RAMP provided 100%

Study: Clinical diagnosis of 8274 samples with 2019-novel coronavirus in Wuhan medrxiv
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Among the 8274 subjects, 2745 (33.2%) had 2019-nCoV infection; 5277 (63.8%) subjects showed negative results in the 2019-nCoV nucleic acid test (non-2019-nCoV).

Study: Recent advances in the detection of respiratory virus infection in humans Journal of Medical Virology
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): Sensitivity and specificity of rRT‐PCR kits for detecting upE and ORF1a reach 100% (95% confidence interval [CI], 0.60‐1.00) and 100% (95% CI, 0.79‐1.00), respectively.The RT‐LAMP‐VF assay can detect 2 × 101 copies/μL of synthesized RNA transcript and 1 × 101 copies/μL of MERS‐CoV RNA without cross‐reactivity to multiple SARS‐related‐CoVs, including HKU1, HKU4, OC43 and 229E, thus exhibiting high specificity.

Study: Molecular Diagnosis of a Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Causing an Outbreak of Pneumonia
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): The amplification efficiencies of ORF1b and N gene assays were 99.6% and 95.4%, respectively (R2 > 0.99 in both cases).

Study: Detection of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) by real-time RT-PCR
Measure of Evidence (Sn & Sp): All assays were highly sensitive, with best results obtained for the E gene and RdRp gene assays (5.2 and 3.8 copies per reaction at 95% detection probability, respectively).
